official-title.#text:
To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide
		  requirements for the contents of the Transition Assistance Program, and for
		  other purposes.

committee-name.#tail:
, and in
			 addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the
			 Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the
			 jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Servicemembers’ Choice in Transition
			 Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 subsection:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1144 of title
			 10, United States Code

text.#text:
The program carried out by this section shall consist of
				at least five days of instruction as follows:

At least one day
				of service-specific pre-separation training, as determined by the Secretary
				concerned.

Not more than one
				day of instruction providing an overview of each of the following
				subjects:

Preparation for
				education or career or technical training.

Other options
				determined by the Secretary concerned.

At least two days
				of in-depth instruction in the participants choice of the subjects described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and in other subjects determined by the Secretary
				concerned.

text.#text:
Not more than one
				day of instruction in the benefits under laws administered by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall comply with the requirements of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1144 of
			 title 10, United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of such section, as added by

, by not later than 180 days
			 after the date of the enactment of this Act.
